Savanna

  • High temperature
  • Dry winter but rainy summer
  • Occurance of droughts and fires
  • Covered in grass
  • Fewer trees

Lion

The lion is known for it's strenght and nobel look.  Since the savanna is covered in grass, lions can approach their pray stealthily and have the element of suprise. Also they live in prides where the females hunt and males defend pride's territory.

Cheetah

Cheetah is the fastest land animal in the world and it can reach a speed higher than 100 km per hour in a matter if seconds. High speed, quiet approach to their choosen pray and excellent eyesight makes cheetahs briliant hunters.

Elephant

 Elephants live in herds and each time a member has been far away for a while, it is being greeted and each time a member passes away others are likely to morn. They are pretty smart and also have 3 times more neurons compared to humans.

Giraffe

Giraffes are the tallest mamals on the planet which helps them reach their main substace of diet - tree leaves. Adult giraffe is enough tall to spot lions or other predators before they attack, thought they are not likely to be prayed since their height makes them hard to kill.

Arctic Hare

Posted on August 16, 2017

Arctic hares can be found in the North American  tundra. Unlike most of the rabbits, Arctic hare has adapted to the harsh tundra enviroment. For example, it’s fur changes color according to the season – white during the winter (for sunray absorption and snow blending) and gray for the summer.Read More

Puffin

Posted on August 16, 2017

Famous for their colorful bills and adorable look, puffins live mainly in the open ocean but can also be found near the coasts of  Greenland, Iceland, Norway, eastern Canada and some parts of Russia and norhern Britain. It’s estimated that over 50% of the world puffins population lives nearRead More

Meet the penguins

Posted on August 15, 2017

Penguins are classified as birds, but they have adjusted to swimming rather than flying. They are excelent swimmers which helps them catch their pray. It’s common knowledge that penguins inhabit Antarctica but that’s not true about some species. In order to get to know them, here are 12 factsRead More
